headers.hostingOnGH: Hosting Material Docs on GitHub Pages

HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.prevTutorial: This tutorial uses a project created in
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.overview: Material Docs - is a single page application that uses __react-router-dom__. It means that when switching between pages, _URL_ changes without reloading the page. When a user visits a site that hosted with GitHub Pages, the hosting will return the __index.thml__ page or the one specified in the _URL_.
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.overview2: Simply put, if we host Material Docs on GitHub Pages without additional configuration - on page reload will receive page __404 | Not found__.
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.suggestions:
In order to prevent this problem, it is proposed:
* Create a __404.html__ page that will put the path from _URL_ into the __query string__ of the request and redirect to _URL_, which leads to __index.html__.
* On the __index.html__ page, we will parse the __query string__ back and put everything back in the __ position before react__ starts.
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.jekyll: Create a __.nojekyll__ file in the __public__ directory. It is needed so that GitHub Pages does not use the Jekyll framework.
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.page404: Now, you need to add the __404.html__ file to the __public__ directory with the following content:
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.segmentCount:
> The variable ___segmentCount___ indicates the number of path elements that do not need to be serialized.
> In the case of GitHub Pages, you need to set the value ___segmentCount___ = 1.
> If you are going to link your own domain, count ___segmentCount___ and set it.
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.pageIndex: Next, add the following code to the __index.html__ file in the _head_ tag:
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.compiling: Now, all that remains is to compile Material Docs and set up GitHub Pages :)
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.repoCreation: Create a repository on _GitHub_ with any name, in our case - ___material-docs-example-project___. After, upload files to it using any software of your choice.
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.packageSetup:
> In the __package.json__ file, add the _homepage_ field with the URL of the page on GitHub Pages.
> Example address
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.building:
In order to place the documentation on GitHub Pages, you need to compile the project. To do this, you must run
command in the directory where the file is located
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.dirSetup:
Thus, we got an almost ready-to-publish web page in the __build__ directory.
Rename this directory to __docs__.
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.settings: Go to the __Settings__ section of your repository and find the __GitHub Pages__ subsection there.
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.source: In the __Source__ section, select the target branch, and in the __directory__ field, select ___ /docs___. Save the settings.
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.hostingSetup:
> For example, we will use the subdomain ___ example.material-docs.com ___
> _Domain management interface may differ depending on your hosting. In the example, hosting_ __Imena.ua__
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.hostingSettings: Go to the domain settings and add an entry:
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.hostingComment:
> If you are not using a subdomain - instead of _example_, enter ___www___
> _185.199.111.153 - GitHub Pages address at the time of the tutorial creation ._
HostingMaterialDocsOnGHPagesTutorial.hostingSteps:
* Calculate the value of the ___segmentCount___ parameter in the __404.html__ file. ([How to do it] (#solution-in-practice))
* In the __package.json__ file, set __your domain__ in the _homepage_ field.
* Add a domain to the GitHub Pages settings in the domain field.

CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.creatingProjectText:
Let's create a new project using the utility __create-react-app__. More about this utility [here](&&createReactAppLink).  
We named the project _material-docs-example-project_ :).
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.setup: After the project is created, you need to install Material Docs.
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.indexSetup:
Material Docs uses the _Roboto_ font, let's install it.
In the directory __public__ add to file ___index.html___ the next:
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.indexOverview: File ___index.html___ should look something like this:
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.basicStructure: First, let's create the following structure in the __index.js__ file:
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.indexJsDescription:
This is the basic structure for a Material Docs app.  
We have specified the following parameters for the component ```<DocsLayout/>```:

props.name: Documentation name.
props.keywords: Key words of the page so that search engines can index it.
props.author: Author's name.

CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.moreInfo:
You can get more information on components in the __Component APIs__ section of this documentation. For example, here is [__documentation of the component__ ```<DocsLayout/>```]().  

In the ```<DocsMenu/>``` component stored information about menu structure. Component ```<AutoDocsMenu/>``` allows don't think about creating the menu manually.  

Inside ```<DocsPages/>``` component there will be pages.
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.creatingPage: Let's start writing the information page. Create a page about yourself:
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.creatingPageComponent: In order to make it easier to edit pages, we recommend creating page components and placing them in separate files. For example, let's wrap our page in a component:
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.pagesGrouping:
In order for the automatic menu to create groups of pages, they must be wrapped in a ```<PagesGroup/>``` component. 
Let's wrap the FirstPage in a group "My Group"
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.redirecting:
The ```<Link/>```  component has ___page___ prop,in which the path is passed to the inner page. 
Since the page we want to redirect to is in the __My Group__, the path will look like this:
CreatingMaterialDocsTutorial.githubExample: You can find this example on GitHub [here](&&gitHubSource)

TablesDemo.simpleTableSummary: Tables are needed to showcase a lot of structured data.
TablesDemo.tablesWithMarkdownSummary: You can use the __Markdown__ component to customize tables. Don't forget to set the ```typographyInheritSize``` and ```inline``` props in the __Markdown__ component
TablesDemo.moreInfoSummary: You can find more info about tables usage [here](https://material-ui.com/components/tables/).

CodeDemo.globalDetails: Code showers - these are React components created to enable the user to showcase the source code.
CodeDemo.codeDetails: You can use the ```Code``` component to showcase your sources or other code.
CodeDemo.expansionCodeDetails:
If you want your code to have additional features such as:
* Ability to collapse code
* Ability to copy code to clipboard
* Ability to add additional actions.


  Then ```ExpansionCode``` is the right choice.
CodeDemo.demoWithCodeDetails: The ```DemoWithCode``` component is used to demonstrate the functionality that the code implements. It expands the capabilities of the [```ExpansionCode```](#<expansioncode>) component

ImagesDemo.pageAbout: Pictures are needed in order to visually demonstrate some information
ImagesDemo.infoBlock: You don't have to worry about page loading speed due to large images. The __Image__ component supports __lazy loading__ technology.

TextDecoratorsDemo.pageAbout: You can customize our text using Material Docs test styling components
TextDecoratorsDemo.infoBlock1:
Decorating text components serve to make the __ information__ on your page __ more responsive__.
> Highlight more important information into different __ specialized blocks__.

HeadersDemo.pageAbout: Headers can be used to separate information by sense.
HeadersDemo.infoBlock1: You can use 6 types of headers: ```H1```, ```H2```, ```H3```, ```H4```, ```H5```. They differ from each other in size and in that headings below H3 do not draw a dividing line by default and are not added to the automatically generated page content block. The larger the number in the title, the smaller its size. Thus, ```H1``` is the largest heading, and ```H6``` is the smallest.
HeadersDemo.tagsInfo: To prevent the title from creating paragraphs in the automatic content of the page - pass it the __parameter__ ```noTag```. If the title creates is present in the content - when you hover over it with the mouse - the button for changing the anchor will be displayed on the left for conveniently specifying the place on the page when copying __url__.
HeadersDemo.dividerInfo: To prevent the title from having a separator line - pass it the __ parameter__ ```noDivider```.
HeadersDemo.anchorInfo: You can set the anchor for the title manually using the ```id``` parameter. If not specified, the title will automatically generate an anchor from its content.

MarkdownDemo.pageAbout: Markdown - component, designed to convert text in markdown notation to Material Docs.
MarkdownDemo.infoBlock1: Markdown is a lightweight markup language that you can use to create articles, notes, etc.
MarkdownDemo.moreInfoDetails: If you want to get more info about markdown syntax - see [this guide](https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/)
MarkdownDemo.infoBlock2: Classically, __markdown__ supports two kinds of code blocks: inline and block. In Material Docs, there are three ways to demonstrate code - using components: ```Code```, ```ExpansionCode```, ```DemoWithCode```. You can select one of these components right in the markdown code.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of code block. For Code - "code"

params.name: type
params.description: Type of code block. For ExpansionCode - "expansion-code"

params.name: name
params.description: The name param for ExpansionCode element. Will be displayed in H3 header.

params.name: collapsedHeight
params.description: collapsedHeight param for Code component. This is a code block height when it is collapsed.

codeComponents.name: Demo with code
codeComponents.description: If you want to provide ```DemoWithCode``` element with demo component, you should pass to ```Markdown``` component prop data with object. Then pass key to demo param in markdown code block and ```Markdown``` will get demo component from data.

params.name: type
params.description: Type of code block. For DemoWithCode - "demo-with-code"

params.name: name
params.description: The name param for DemoWithCode element. Will be displayed in H3 header.

params.name: demo
params.description: Key of variable in data object.

DocsPageAPI.searchDescription: DocsPage - react component, designed to provide user with page functional

props.name: Page name. Route will be generated automatically from name.
props.searchLabel: Label text, displayed in search result if page match search requirements.
props.searchDescription: Description text, displayed in search result if page match search requirements.
props.noGenerateAutoSearch: If true, page will not generate search items from pages automatically.
props.noAutoMenu: If true, page will not participate in auto menu generation.
props.order: As lower order as higher will be displayed menu item.
props.children: Children of an element.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.contentItem: Styles applied to the item element of content panel.
css.contentItemActive: Styles applied to the item element of content panel if it is active.
css.contentLink: Styles applied to the link of item element of content panel.
css.copyright: Styles applied to copyright panel if it shown.

DemoWithCodeAPI.searchDescription: DemoWithCode - react component, designed to create code blocks with interactive demo.

props.name: Name of the component. Will be displayed in H3 header if defined.
props.code: Code to display in inner Code block.
props.ratio: If defined, demo field will keep input aspect ratio.
props.defaultExpanded: If true - code area will be expanded on startup.
props.noTag: If true and name prop is defined - header with name will not generate tag for content tab.
props.paperContainer: If true - demo content will be wrapped in Paper component.
props.actions: Array of additional actions. The actions will be displayed in the dropdown menu when you click the ExpandMore icon button.
props.p: Padding of demo block in _theme.spacing_ units.
props.m: Margin of demo block in _theme.spacing_ units.
props.theme: Code highlighting and background styling type.
props.themeLight: Code highlighting and background styling type when global theme in light mode.
props.themeDark: Code highlighting and background styling type when global theme in dark mode.
props.children: Children of an element. Will be placed in demo block.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.collapse: Styles applied to the Collapse element, which contains code.
css.toolbar: Styles applied to the Toolbar element with icon buttons and name.
css.paperContainer: Styles applied to the Paper container element if paperContainer prop is true.
css.menuButtonLink: Styles applied to link in extra actions menu.

CodeAPI.searchDescription: Code - react component, designed to create code blocks.

props.theme: Code highlighting and background styling type.
props.themeLight: Code highlighting and background styling type when global theme in light mode.
props.themeDark: Code highlighting and background styling type when global theme in dark mode.
props.children: Code to display in code highlighter.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.highlighterContainer: Styles applied to the code highlighter container.

PagesGroupAPI.searchDescription: PagesGroup - react component, designed to combine pages in groups for AutoDocsMenu.

props.name: Name of the group. Will be displayed on button in menu.
props.getData: Callback, provided to get group data without context usage.
props.order: As lower order as higher will be displayed menu item.
props.defaultExpanded: If true, menu group will be expanded on startup.
props.children: Children of an element.

LandingAPI.searchDescription: Landing - react component, designed to provide documentation with free style landing page.

props.children: Children of an element.

LangProviderAPI.searchDescription: LangProvider - react component, designed to provide children with locale lang settings.

props.lang: lang extension, will be merged with main lang. To main lang will be added fields from provider lang if in main lang they are not defined.
props.children: Children of an element.

LocaleAPI.searchDescription: Locale - react component, designed to provide user with flexible locale access.

props.path: Path to the data in the Lang.locale. Exampele: "hello/darkness/my".
props.children: Children of an element. Will be displayed by default if can not load data from Lang.

LinkAPI.searchDescription: Link - react component, designed to create links to outside resource or inner docs page.

props.page: Page route. Can be passed as string or as array of routes.
props.children: Children of an element. Will be displayed by default if can not load data from Lang.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.

ImageAPI.searchDescription: Image - react component, designed to show images. Image component uses lazy load technology.

props.src: Source link. Used to define image path.
props.placeholderSrc: Src of low quality image, which will be displayed while main image is loading.
props.alt: Alternative text. Will be displayed if image can not load.
props.fullWidth: If true - image will be 100 percent wide.
props.frame: If true, image will be placed inside decorative border frame.
props.children: Elements, which will appear in image caption.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.fullWidth: Styles applied to the root component if fullWidth prop is true.

ListItemAPI.searchDescription: ListItem - react component, designed to generate list. Component simulates list item component.

props.dense: If true, vertical distance between list items will be smaller.
props.children: Children of an element.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.typeCircle: Styles applied to the root component if type prop equals circle.
css.typeSquare: Styles applied to the root component if type prop equals square.
css.typeRoman: Styles applied to the root component if type prop equals upper-roman.
css.typeAlpha: Styles applied to the root component if type prop equals lower-alpha.
css.typeNone: Styles applied to the root component if type prop equals none.
css.list: Styles applied to the inner ul element.
css.dense: Styles applied to the root element if prop dense is true.

ExpansionCodeAPI.searchDescription: ExpansionCode - react component, designed to show code in collapsable blocks. User can view full code or part of code.

props.name: Name of the code block. If defined - it will appear in H3 header in ExpansionCode toolbar.
props.noTag: If true and name prop is true - header will not generate tags fot content panel.
props.collapsedHeight: Height of the component when it is collapsed.
props.actions: Array of additional actions. The actions will be displayed in the dropdown menu when you click the ExpandMore icon button.
props.theme: Code highlighting and background styling type.
props.themeLight: Code highlighting and background styling type when global theme in light mode.
props.themeDark: Code highlighting and background styling type when global theme in dark mode.
props.children: Code to display in code highlighter. This code will appear in the Code block if component is expanded.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.collapsedCode: Styles applied to the div element between Collapse component and Code component when code is collapsed.
css.collapse: Styles applied to the Collapse component, which contains Code.
css.toolbar: Styles applied to the Toolbar component.
css.codeName: Styles applied to the H3 header with text from prop name.
css.menuButtonLink: Styles applied to link element of actions menu button.

BlockAPI.searchDescription: Block - react component, designed to show slided information blocks, such as tips, notes, etc.

props.color: Color styling, which will be applied to block.
props.children: Children of an element.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.colorLight: Styles applied to the root element when prop color equals "light"
css.colorDark: Styles applied to the root element when prop color equals "dark"

CodeSpanAPI.searchDescription: CodeSpan - react component, designed to show code in monospace font inside inline code block.

props.color: Background color of the inline code block.
props.children: Children of an element.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.colorDefault: Styles applied to the root element when prop color equals "default"
css.colorPrimary: Styles applied to the root element when prop color equals "primary"
css.colorSecondary: Styles applied to the root element when prop color equals "secondary"
css.colorGrey: Styles applied to the root element when prop color equals "grey"
css.font: Styles applied to the root element and defining font properties
css.textInherit: Styles applied to the root element when prop text equals "inherit"
css.textWhite: Styles applied to the root element when prop text equals "white"
css.textBlack: Styles applied to the root element when prop text equals "black"

ItalicAPI.searchDescription: Italic - react component, designed to make text italic.

props.children: Children of an element.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.italic: Styles applied to the root element, provides italic text styling.

ItalicAPI.searchDescription: Italic - react component, designed to make text italic.

props.path: Path to the data in the Lang.locale. Exampele: __"hello/darkness/my"__.
props.children: Children of the component. Will be displayed by default if can not load data from Lang.

ListAPI.searchDescription: List - react component, designed to show code in monospace font inside inline code block.

props.image: List styling image. If defined - will be applied to list-style-image style.
props.children: Children of an element.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.stylePositionInside: Styles applied to the root element when prop styling equals "inside"
css.stylePositionOutside: Styles applied to the root element when prop styling equals "outside"
css.stylePositionInherit: Styles applied to the root element when prop styling equals "inherit"
css.stylePositionRevert: Styles applied to the root element when prop styling equals "revert"
css.stylePositionUnset: Styles applied to the root element when prop styling equals "unset"

DocsMenuItemAPI.searchDescription: DocsMenuItem - react component, designed create menu items for <DocsMenu/>.

props.defaultExpanded: If true, panel will be expanded on startup.
props.textPrimary: Primary text form menu list item.
props.textSecondary: Secondary text for menu list item. Will be displayed in the bottom.
props.icon: Icon, displayed in left corner. Used to customize menu item appearance.
props.onClick: Callback, will be triggered on onclick event handling.
props.page: Page name for redirecting or object structure for routing-manager changeRoute.
props.link: Link to the page, which includes groups. If defined - will be used with highest priority.
props.isCurrent: If equals true or function returned true, button will be active. Used when displayed page, connected to this menu item.
props.dense: If true, compact vertical padding designed for keyboard and mouse input will be used for the list and list items. The prop is available to descendant components as the dense context.
props.children: Children of an element.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.highlighted: Styles applied to the root element when prop isCurrent equals or returned true
css.collapse: Styles applied to the Collapse element for nested menu items.

MarkdownAPI.searchDescription: DocsMenuItem - react component, designed create menu items for <DocsMenu/>.

props.inline: If true, markdown container will be inline.
props.data: Data structure, used as storage to store components or other data, which can not describe via markdown.
props.typographyInheritSize: Paragraph Typography component will inherit font settings.
props.locale: Locale path to get data from. Example: __"where/is/my/data"__. Path starts from _Lang.locale_.
props.children: Markdown based notation. Used to generate visual elements.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.

TableAPI.searchDescription: Table - react component, designed to create tables.

props.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
props.padding: Allows TableCells to inherit padding of the Table.
props.size: Allows TableCells to inherit size of the Table.
props.children: The content of the table, normally TableHead and TableBody.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.stickyHeader: Styles applied to the root element if stickyHeader={true}.

TableRowAPI.searchDescription: TableRow - react component, designed to create tables.

props.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
props.hover: If true, the table row will shade on hover.
props.selected: If true, the table row will have the selected shading.
props.children: Should be valid <tr> children such as TableCell.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.selected: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if selected={true}.
css.hover: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if hover={true}.
css.head: Styles applied to the root element if table variant="head".
css.footer: Styles applied to the root element if table variant="footer".

TableCellAPI.searchDescription: TableCell - react component, designed to create tables.

props.align:
Set the text-align on the table cell content.
Monetary or generally number fields should be right aligned as that allows you to add them up quickly in your head without having to worry about decimals.
props.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
props.padding: Sets the padding applied to the cell. By default, the Table parent component set the value (default).
props.size: Specify the size of the cell. By default, the Table parent component set the value (medium).
props.variant: Specify the cell type. By default, the TableHead, TableBody or TableFooter parent component set the value.
props.children: The table cell contents.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.head: Styles applied to the root element if variant="head" or context.table.head.
css.body: Styles applied to the root element if variant="body" or context.table.body.
css.footer: Styles applied to the root element if variant="footer" or context.table.footer.
css.sizeSmall: Styles applied to the root element if size="small".
css.paddingCheckbox: Styles applied to the root element if padding="checkbox".
css.paddingNone: Styles applied to the root element if padding="none".
css.alignLeft: Styles applied to the root element if align="left".
css.alignCenter: Styles applied to the root element if align="center".
css.alignRight: Styles applied to the root element if align="right".
css.alignJustify: Styles applied to the root element if align="justify".
css.stickyHeader: Styles applied to the root element if context.table.stickyHeader={true}.

TableBodyAPI.searchDescription: TableBody - react component, designed to create tables.

props.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
props.children: The content of the component, normally TableRow.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.

TableHeadAPI.searchDescription: TableHead - react component, designed to create tables.

props.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
props.children: The content of the component, normally TableRow.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.

BoldAPI.searchDescription: Bold - react component, designed to create tables.

props.children: The content of the component.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.bold: Styles applied to the root element with bold text styling.

LanguageSelectorAPI.searchDescription: LanguageSelector - react component, designed to add language selection mechanism and locale management.

props.size: The size of an element. If small - will be displayed just locale icon, if large - locale icon with current language name.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.

SearchFieldAPI.searchDescription: SearchField - react component, designed to add search mechanism.

props.searchData: Array of SearchDataItem items to do search from.
props.doSearch: Callback, called on search. If defined, default search function will not be called. Must return array of SearchDataItem.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.rootFocused: Styles applied to the root element when result item is focused.
css.input: Styles applied to the Input element.
css.iconButton: Styles applied to the IconButton component.
css.iconClickable: Styles applied to the icons with button functional.
css.popper: Styles applied to the Popper element.
css.listPaper: Styles applied to the Paper element, which contains results List.

DocsMenuAPI.searchDescription: DocsMenu - react component, designed to create menu.

props.dense: If true, menu will have smaller spacing between items.
props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenuItem.

DocsPagesAPI.searchDescription: DocsPages - react component, designed to create pages.

props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsPage.

ListItemContainedAPI.searchDescription: ListItemContained - react component, designed to add list items nesting mechanism.

props.children: Children of an element. Normally ListItem.

DocsLayoutAPI.searchDescription: DocsLayout - react component, designed to create MaterialDocs layout.

props.searchData: An array of SearchDataItem items to do search from.
props.noGenerateAutoSearch: If true, Material Docs will not generate search items from pages automatically.
props.onHelpToTranslate: Function, called on help to translate button click. If not defined - button will not be rendered.
props.mask: Mask for routing-manager ChangeRouteProvider routeMask property.
props.noSearchField: If true, search field will not be displayed.
props.noLanguageSelector: If true, language selector will not be displayed.
props.actions: An array of actions. Will be displayed in material-ui IconButton components in Toolbar component inside AppBar.
props.keywords: An array of keywords of the docs for search engines. Needs for metadata.
props.author: The author of the docs. Needs for metadata.
props.description: The description of the docs. Needs for metadata.
props.name: Name of the docs. Needs for metadata. Will be displayed in app header. Also you can find this name near version label in side menu drawer.
props.version: Version of the docs. Needs for metadata.
props.logo: A path to the logo image, will be displayed in drawer near name and version.
props.onNameClick: Callback, designed to handle click on docs name in drawer badge.
props.onVersionClick: Callback, designed to handle click on docs version in drawer badge.
props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenu and DocsPages.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.appBar: Styles applied to the AppBar element.
css.appBarShift: Styles applied to element, designed to compensate drawer.
css.menuButton: Styles applied to the menu button.
css.hide: Styles applied to the menu button when drawer opened.
css.drawer: Styles applied to the Drawer element.
css.drawerPaper: Styles applied to the Paper element inside menu Drawer.
css.drawerHeader: Styles applied to the head element inside menu Drawer.
css.content: Styles applied to the content block.
css.contentShift: Styles applied to the content element to compensate drawer.
css.headerText: Styles applied to the Typography in AppBar.
css.toolbar: Styles applied to the ToolBar element.
css.headerIcon: Styles applied to icons in Toolbar.
css.version: Styles applied to version badge in side drawer menu.

H1API.searchDescription: H1 - react component, designed to create H1 header.

props.noDivider: If true, bottom divider line will not be displayed.
props.noTag: If true, component will not provide tagging mechanism.
props.id: HTML id for the element to provide tagging mechanism.
props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenu and DocsPages.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.h1: Styles applied to the h1 element.

H2API.searchDescription: H2 - react component, designed to create H2 header.

props.noDivider: If true, bottom divider line will not be displayed.
props.noTag: If true, component will not provide tagging mechanism.
props.id: HTML id for the element to provide tagging mechanism.
props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenu and DocsPages.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.h2: Styles applied to the h2 element.

H3API.searchDescription: H3 - react component, designed to create H3 header.

props.noDivider: If true, bottom divider line will not be displayed.
props.noTag: If true, component will not provide tagging mechanism.
props.id: HTML id for the element to provide tagging mechanism.
props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenu and DocsPages.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.h3: Styles applied to the h3 element.

H4API.searchDescription: H4 - react component, designed to create H4 header.

props.noDivider: If true, bottom divider line will not be displayed.
props.noTag: If true, component will not provide tagging mechanism.
props.id: HTML id for the element to provide tagging mechanism.
props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenu and DocsPages.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.h4: Styles applied to the h4 element.

props.noTag: If true, component will not provide tagging mechanism.
props.id: HTML id for the element to provide tagging mechanism.
props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenu and DocsPages.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.h5: Styles applied to the h5 element.

props.noTag: If true, component will not provide tagging mechanism.

props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenu and DocsPages.

css.h6: Styles applied to the h6 element.

HeaderAPI.searchDescription: Header - react component, designed to create headers.

props.heading: Heading size.
props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenu and DocsPages.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.h1: Styles applied to the header when heading = 1.
css.h2: Styles applied to the header when heading = 2.
css.h3: Styles applied to the header when heading = 3.
css.h4: Styles applied to the header when heading = 4.
css.h5: Styles applied to the header when heading = 5.
css.h6: Styles applied to the header when heading = 6.

TagableAPI.searchDescription: Header - react component, designed to create headers.

props.variant: Variant of header. h1 h2 h3 h4 h5.
props.noDivider: If true, bottom divider line will not be displayed.
props.noTag: If true, component will not provide tagging mechanism.
props.id: HTML id for the element to provide tagging mechanism.
props.children: Children of an element. Normally DocsMenu and DocsPages.

css.root: Styles applied to the root element.
css.h1: Styles applied to the header when variant = "h1".
css.h2: Styles applied to the header when variant = "h2".
css.h3: Styles applied to the header when variant = "h3".
css.h4: Styles applied to the header when variant = "h4".
css.h5: Styles applied to the header when variant = "h5".
css.h6: Styles applied to the header when variant = "h6".
css.typography: Styles applied to inner Typography component.
css.anchorIcon: Styles applied to icon in anchor button.

ComponentAPI.summary: The API documentation of the &&name React component. Learn more about the props and the CSS customization points.
ComponentAPI.importDifferenceText: You can learn more about the difference by [reading this guide](https://material-ui.com/guides/minimizing-bundle-size/).
ComponentAPI.customization:
You can override the style of the component thanks to one of these customization points: 
* With a rule name of the  [```classes``` object prop](https://material-ui.com/customization/components/#overriding-styles-with-classes). 
* With a [global class name](https://material-ui.com/customization/components/#overriding-styles-with-global-class-names). 
* With a theme and an [```overrides``` property](https://material-ui.com/customization/globals/#css). 


 If that's not sufficient, you can check the implementation of the component for more detail.
ComponentAPI.componentName:
## Component name  
The ```&&name``` name can be used for providing [default props](https://material-ui.com/customization/globals/#default-props) or [style overrides](https://material-ui.com/customization/globals/#css) at the theme level.
ComponentAPI.refText: The ```ref``` is forwarded to the root element.
ComponentAPI.propsText: Any other props supplied will be provided to the root element (native element).
